verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: Moreover LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Also, thou son of man, thus saith the Lord GOD unto the land of Israel; An end, the end is come upon the four corners of the land.
verses.web: “You, son of man, the Lord LORD says to the land of Israel, ‘An end! The end has come on the four corners of the land.
verses.ct: "Son of man, this is what the Lord GOD says to the land of Israel: The end! The end has come upon the 4 corners of the land.

verses.kjv: Now is the end come upon thee, and I will send mine anger upon thee, and will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense upon thee all thine abominations.
verses.web: Now is the end on you, and I will send my anger on you, and will judge you according to your ways. I will bring on you all your abominations.
verses.ct: Now the end is upon you. I will unleash my anger against you and judge you by how you have lived. I will make you pay for every disgusting thing you've done.

verses.kjv: And mine eye shall not spare thee, neither will I have pity: but I will recompense thy ways upon thee, and thine abominations shall be in the midst of thee: and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: My eye will not spare you, neither will I have pity; but I will bring your ways on you, and your abominations will be among you. Then you will know that I am LORD.’
verses.ct: I will not look on you with pity or show you mercy. I will repay you for the way you've lived, and your own disgusting practices will be right there among you. Then you will know that I am the LORD."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; An evil, an only evil, behold, is come.
verses.web: “The Lord LORD says: ‘An evil! A unique evil! Behold, it comes.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: "Disaster! A disaster like no other — look, it's coming!

verses.kjv: An end is come, the end is come: it watcheth for thee; behold, it is come.
verses.web: An end has come. The end has come! It awakes against you. Behold, it comes.
verses.ct: The end has come. The end has come! It has awakened against you. Look — it's here.

verses.kjv: The morning is come unto thee, O thou that dwellest in the land: the time is come, the day of trouble is near, and not the sounding again of the mountains.
verses.web: Your doom has come to you, inhabitant of the land! The time has come! The day is near, a day of tumult, and not of joyful shouting, on the mountains.
verses.ct: Your doom has arrived, you who live in the land! The time has come, the day is near — a day of chaos, not joyful celebration on the mountains.

verses.kjv: Now will I shortly pour out my fury upon thee, and accomplish mine anger upon thee: and I will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense thee for all thine abominations.
verses.web: Now I will shortly pour out my wrath on you, and accomplish my anger against you, and will judge you according to your ways. I will bring on you all your abominations.
verses.ct: Very soon I will pour out my fury on you and spend my full anger against you. I will judge you by how you have lived and make you pay for every disgusting thing you've done.

verses.kjv: And mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: I will recompense thee according to thy ways and thine abominations that are in the midst of thee; and ye shall know that I am the LORD that smiteth.
verses.web: My eye won’t spare, neither will I have pity. I will punish you according to your ways. Your abominations will be among you. Then you will know that I, LORD, strike.
verses.ct: I will not look on you with pity or show you mercy. I will punish you for the way you've lived, and your disgusting practices will be right there among you. Then you will know that I am the LORD, the one who strikes.

verses.kjv: Behold the day, behold, it is come: the morning is gone forth; the rod hath blossomed, pride hath budded.
verses.web: “ ‘Behold, the day! Behold, it comes! Your doom has gone out. The rod has blossomed. Pride has budded.
verses.ct: "Look — the day! It's here! Your doom has gone out. Arrogance has blossomed like a rod putting out buds, and pride has sprouted.

verses.kjv: Violence is risen up into a rod of wickedness: none of them shall remain, nor of their multitude, nor of any of theirs: neither shall there be wailing for them.
verses.web: Violence has risen up into a rod of wickedness. None of them will remain, nor of their multitude, nor of their wealth. There will be nothing of value among them.
verses.ct: Violence has grown into a weapon of wickedness. None of them will survive — not their crowds, not their wealth. Nothing of value will be left among them.

verses.kjv: The time is come, the day draweth near: let not the buyer rejoice, nor the seller mourn: for wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.
verses.web: The time has come! The day draws near. Don’t let the buyer rejoice, nor the seller mourn; for wrath is on all its multitude.
verses.ct: The time has come, the day is near. Buyers shouldn't celebrate, and sellers shouldn't grieve, because wrath is coming against the whole crowd.

verses.kjv: For the seller shall not return to that which is sold, although they were yet alive: for the vision is touching the whole multitude thereof, which shall not return; neither shall any strengthen himself in the iniquity of his life.
verses.web: For the seller won’t return to that which is sold, although they are still alive; for the vision concerns the whole multitude of it. None will return. None will strengthen himself in the iniquity of his life.
verses.ct: Sellers will never return to reclaim what they sold, even if they're still alive, because this vision concerns everyone — none of it will be reversed. No one will be able to hold on to their life through sin.

verses.kjv: They have blown the trumpet, even to make all ready; but none goeth to the battle: for my wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.
verses.web: They have blown the trumpet, and have made all ready; but no one goes to the battle; for my wrath is on all its multitude.
verses.ct: They've blown the trumpet and made everything ready, but no one marches out to fight, because my wrath is against the whole crowd.

verses.kjv: The sword is without, and the pestilence and the famine within: he that is in the field shall die with the sword; and he that is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.
verses.web: “ ‘The sword is outside, and the pestilence and the famine within. He who is in the field will die by the sword. He who is in the city will be devoured by famine and pestilence.
verses.ct: "Outside the city, the sword waits. Inside the city, plague and famine. Anyone in the open fields will die by the sword, and anyone in the city will be consumed by famine and disease.

verses.kjv: But they that escape of them shall escape, and shall be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them mourning, every one for his iniquity.
verses.web: But those of those who escape, they will escape and will be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them moaning, everyone in his iniquity.
verses.ct: Some will escape and flee to the mountains, but they'll be like doves in the valleys — all of them moaning, each one over their own sin.

verses.kjv: All hands shall be feeble, and all knees shall be weak as water.
verses.web: All hands will be feeble, and all knees will be weak as water.
verses.ct: Every hand will go limp, and every knee will turn weak as water.

verses.kjv: They shall also gird themselves with sackcloth, and horror shall cover them; and shame shall be upon all faces, and baldness upon all their heads.
verses.web: They will also clothe themselves with sackcloth, and horror will cover them. Shame will be on all faces, and baldness on all their heads.
verses.ct: They will dress in sackcloth, and horror will overwhelm them. Shame will cover every face, and every head will be shaved bare.

verses.kjv: They shall cast their silver in the streets, and their gold shall be removed: their silver and their gold shall not be able to deliver them in the day of the wrath of the LORD: they shall not satisfy their souls, neither fill their bowels: because it is the stumblingblock of their iniquity.
verses.web: They will cast their silver in the streets, and their gold will be as an unclean thing. Their silver and their gold won’t be able to deliver them in the day of LORD’s wrath. They won’t satisfy their souls or fill their bellies; because it has been the stumbling block of their iniquity.
verses.ct: They will throw their silver into the streets, and their gold will be treated like garbage. Their silver and gold won't be able to save them on the day of the LORD's wrath. It won't fill their stomachs or satisfy their souls, because their wealth became the very thing that tripped them into sin.

verses.kjv: As for the beauty of his ornament, he set it in majesty: but they made the images of their abominations and of their detestable things therein: therefore have I set it far from them.
verses.web: As for the beauty of his ornament, he set it in majesty; but they made the images of their abominations and their detestable things therein. Therefore I have made it to them as an unclean thing.
verses.ct: They took the beauty of their jewelry and used it to craft magnificent idols — disgusting, detestable images. So I will turn their treasure into something repulsive to them.

verses.kjv: And I will give it into the hands of the strangers for a prey, and to the wicked of the earth for a spoil; and they shall pollute it.
verses.web: I will give it into the hands of the strangers for a prey, and to the wicked of the earth for a plunder; and they will profane it.
verses.ct: I will hand it over to foreigners as plunder and to the most wicked people on earth as loot, and they will defile it.

verses.kjv: My face will I turn also from them, and they shall pollute my secret place: for the robbers shall enter into it, and defile it.
verses.web: I will also turn my face from them, and they will profane my secret place. Robbers will enter into it, and profane it.
verses.ct: I will turn my face away from my people, and invaders will desecrate my treasured place. Robbers will break in and defile it.

verses.kjv: Make a chain: for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of violence.
verses.web: “ ‘Make chains; for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of violence.
verses.ct: "Forge chains! The land is drenched in bloodshed, and the city is overflowing with violence.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I will bring the worst of the heathen, and they shall possess their houses: I will also make the pomp of the strong to cease; and their holy places shall be defiled.
verses.web: Therefore I will bring the worst of the nations, and they will possess their houses. I will also make the pride of the strong to cease. Their holy places will be profaned.
verses.ct: So I will bring the most ruthless nations, and they will seize their homes. I will put an end to the arrogance of the powerful, and their holy places will be desecrated.

verses.kjv: Destruction cometh; and they shall seek peace, and there shall be none.
verses.web: Destruction comes! They will seek peace, and there will be none.
verses.ct: Destruction is coming! They will desperately look for peace, but there will be none.

verses.kjv: Mischief shall come upon mischief, and rumour shall be upon rumour; then shall they seek a vision of the prophet; but the law shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the ancients.
verses.web: Mischief will come on mischief, and rumor will be on rumor. They will seek a vision of the prophet; but the law will perish from the priest, and counsel from the elders.
verses.ct: One disaster will pile on top of another, and rumor will follow rumor. They will beg the prophets for a vision, but the priests will have no instruction to give, and the elders will have no counsel to offer.

verses.kjv: The king shall mourn, and the prince shall be clothed with desolation, and the hands of the people of the land shall be troubled: I will do unto them after their way, and according to their deserts will I judge them; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: The king will mourn, and the prince will be clothed with desolation. The hands of the people of the land will be troubled. I will do to them after their way, and according to their own judgments I will judge them. Then they will know that I am LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: The king will be in mourning, the prince will be wrapped in despair, and the hands of the common people will tremble with fear. I will deal with them exactly as they have lived, and I will judge them by their own standards. Then they will know that I am the LORD."
